routine.name: addGatewayDeviceToDb
routine.Comment:
Add newly provisioned SMSEagle devices to the database
Parameters:
- smeagleName - The name of the device, smeagleXXX
- smeaglePassword - The user_password for the device, found in group_vars/us_east_1_vpn.yml

routine.name: massArchiveActiveMessages
routine.Comment:
Mass archive active messages for a site in a given timestamp range
Parameters: - companyId - The ID of the company for which to archive the active messages - startTime - The timestamp of the oldest message to be archived - endTime - The timestamp of the most recent message to be archived

routine.name: terminateProperty
routine.Comment:
Terminate Property from Kipsu
Parameters: - companyId - A companyId of the property to be terminated - companyName - A companyName of the property to be terminated

routine.name: updateSmseagleTestNumber
routine.Comment:
Update the testing number for SMSEagle devices
Parameters:
- authKey - The api_key listed in group_vars/us_east_1_vpn.yml
- gatewayDeviceId - The ID from the gateway_device table, not to be mistaken for smeagle#

table.name: api_event_publish_topic
table.Comment: A pub/sub topic that API events can be published to

table.name: auto_reply
table.Comment: Hours of operation

table.name: consent_request
table.Comment: Created when a Kipsu user attempts to get consent to send messages to a guest

table.name: customer_field
table.Comment: Custom guest field for a property

table.name: customer_field_option
table.Comment: Allowed value for a guest custom field

table.name: customer_number_customer_field_option
table.Comment: Association of a guest with a guest field allowed value

table.name: external_lease_id
table.Comment: The External Company's unique identifier for a lease.

table.name: external_lease_id_type
table.Comment: The External Company's name for the unique identifier for a lease.

table.name: external_lease_status
table.Comment: The External Company's representation for a Lease status.

table.name: external_lease_status_type
table.Comment: The External Company's name for the unique identifier for a lease.

table.name: external_machine
table.Comment: Matching a QR code to a specific hotel workstation

table.name: guest_external_machine_matching
table.Comment: WHETHER OTT CONVO HAS MATCHED WITH WMR CUSTOMER

table.name: hotsos_cache
table.Comment: Caching layer for HotSOS data (issue types, locations, etc.)

table.name: identity_provider_claim_rule
table.Comment: A singular rule to map identity provider claim keys to kipsu normalized claims

table.name: identity_provider_role_map
table.Comment: Provider specific role values and their mapping into kipsu

table.name: lease
table.Comment: Describes a Lease.

table.name: lease_age
table.Comment: The possibilities of the age of a Lease.

table.name: lease_resident_type
table.Comment: Lease Resident Type ties a Resident to a Lease since a Resident may be a different type on multiple Leases of different status.

table.name: lease_status
table.Comment: The possibilities of the status of a Lease.

table.name: lease_type
table.Comment: The possibilities of the type of a Lease.

table.name: message_blueprint_attribute
table.Comment: An attribute a message blueprint may have

table.name: message_blueprint_message_blueprint_attribute
table.Comment: A message blueprint's association with an attribute

table.name: option
table.Comment: For company options that the company can turn on and off

table.name: parent_child
table.Comment: Describes the child (mall or hotel) companies that belong to

table.name: resident_type
table.Comment: The possibilities of a type of Resident.

table.name: scheduled_message_queue
table.Comment: A queue to assist in processing scheduled messages to send. Helps prevent sending duplicate.

table.name: sequence
table.Comment: Sequences are messaging campaigns that will send out messages based on timing throughout a resident's lease.

table.name: sequence_membership_criteria
table.Comment: Membership Criteria describe the conditions that must be met for a resident to be sent a message.

table.name: service_queue
table.Comment: Queue of entities awaiting some service

table.name: service_queue_guest
table.Comment: Presence of a guest in a service queue

table.name: service_queue_guest_history
table.Comment: Past presence of a guest in a service queue

table.name: service_queue_reason
table.Comment: Reason an entity is in a service queue

table.name: service_queue_service_queue_reason
table.Comment: Reason an entity is in a specific service queue

table.name: service_queue_type
table.Comment: Type of service queue

table.name: touchpoint
table.Comment: Touchpoint in a Sequence represents an instance where a Message will be sent based on timing within a Resident's Lease.

table.name: touchpoint_message
table.Comment: The record of a Message to be sent to a Resident.

table.name: touchpoint_message_delay
table.Comment: The record of the messages delays and status changes.

table.name: touchpoint_message_delay_reason
table.Comment: Reasons Message sending might be delayed.

table.name: touchpoint_message_template
table.Comment: The template for a Message in a Touchpoint.

table.name: touchpoint_sending_trigger
table.Comment: The criteria involved to determine when a Touchpoint Message should be sent to a Resident.

table.name: user_company_ids
table.Comment: Companies that a user belongs to, has access to

table.name: wechat_guest_action_log
table.Comment: A temporary table to log WeChat guest QR code scanning activity

column.name: action
column.Comment: User assigns convo, convo assigned to user, and user completes convo

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: company_id
column.Comment: The company associated with the announcement.

column.name: title
column.Comment: The title of the announcement.

column.name: text
column.Comment: The text of the announcement.

column.name: start_timestamp
column.Comment: The beginning timestamp of the announcement.

column.name: end_timestamp
column.Comment: The ending timestamp of the announcement.

column.name: user_id
column.Comment: The user who last updated the announcement.

column.name: last_updated
column.Comment: The timestamp of the last time the announcement was updated.

column.name: room_range
column.Comment: The range of rooms the announcement applies to.

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: name
column.Comment: Human readable name for this url

column.name: tls_version
column.Comment: Version of connection encryption to use for webhooks

column.name: topic
column.Comment: Topic events are published to

column.name: created_date
column.Comment: When the record was created

column.name: created_by
column.Comment: user_id of the Kipsu user who created the record

column.name: updated_date
column.Comment: When the record was last updated

column.name: updated_by
column.Comment: user_id of the Kipsu user who last updated the record

column.name: scope
column.Comment: Scope of the event type to send (i.e. specific type of conversation).

column.name: purpose
column.Comment: Used to filter triggered webhooks by default_location

column.name: field_name
column.Comment: The name of the field in the format that we use to place into Boots.

column.name: label
column.Comment: The label of the field to display in the Kipsu UI for the user to map to.

column.name: required
column.Comment: Boolean value to signify whether or not the field is required.

column.name: unique
column.Comment: Boolean value to signify whether or not the field is unique (cannot be mapped to more than once).

column.name: type
column.Comment: A field to signify what the mapped field applies to. It could be a guest, reservation, tag, etc.

column.name: archived
column.Comment: Category has been archived and is only used for historical reporting

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: service_number
column.Comment: Number that if any of the Twilio numbers are called, the caller will be forwarded to this number

column.name: group_msg
column.Comment: 0 = disabled

column.name: salt
column.Comment: Salt used when computing hashes for a company.

column.name: has_hashed_numbers
column.Comment: Indicates that a company has hashed guest numbers.

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: visible
column.Comment: If 1, the asset will be visible in the digital asset manager. If 0, it will not be.

column.name: customer_number_id
column.Comment: Connects asset to a specific guest if the asset is private to them. Null if it's a public asset.

column.name: reservation_id
column.Comment: Connects asset to a specific reservation if the asset is private to that reservation. Null if it is not tied to a reservation.

column.name: updated_at_dt
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: company_id
column.Comment: The company associated with this csv mapping.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The saved name of this bulk import mapping for this company.

column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: daily_kpi
column.Comment: The daily KPI is calculated by (sum of convos since friday / (sum of response times since friday / sum of responses since friday))

column.name: trusted_access_group_name
column.Comment: Name to be used in LPS Trusted Access Groups.

column.name: description
column.Comment: A description of the TA group in LPS. Informational only.

column.Comment: The id of the message that was concealed.

column.Comment: The id of the user who concealed the message.

column.Comment: The time at which the message was concealed.

column.Comment: The way in which an import and a message guest record were matched

column.Comment: The user_id of the agent performing the match

column.Comment: Whether guest record came in from a check-in or an OTT message

column.name: id_token_algorithm_id
column.Comment: Internal unique identifier

column.name: algorithm
column.Comment: The RFC 7519 compliant algorithm to sign a JWT

column.name: identity_provider_id
column.Comment: Internal unique identifier

column.name: name
column.Comment: Internal name

column.name: url
column.Comment: URL used when authenticating with this provider

column.name: json_web_key_set_url
column.Comment: URL of provider's public keys

column.name: client_id
column.Comment: Identifier to use with this provider (typically represents Kipsu itself)

column.name: client_secret
column.Comment: Secret for client_id

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: When the record was created

column.name: created_by
column.Comment: user_id of the Kipsu user who created the record

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: When the record was last updated

column.name: updated_by
column.Comment: user_id of the Kipsu user who last updated the record

column.name: id_token_algorithm_id
column.Comment: id_token_algorithm id to specify which algorithm was used to sign the token

column.name: issuer
column.Comment: used to match the iss field for token validation

column.name: authorization_endpoint
column.Comment: endpoint used to authorize OIDC requests

column.name: token_endpoint
column.Comment: url to exchange token for access key

column.name: identity_provider_claim_rule_id
column.Comment: Internal unique key for table.

column.name: identity_provider_id
column.Comment: Identity provider this claim rule applies to.

column.name: provider_claim
column.Comment: OAuth claim name provided by the identity provider.

column.name: mapped_claim
column.Comment: claim in kipsu to translate the claim name to.

column.name: identity_provider_role_map_id
column.Comment: internal key for the table

column.name: identity_provider_id
column.Comment: The identity provider this role mapping applies to.

column.name: provider_role_name
column.Comment: The name of the role provided by the IDP this rule will map

column.name: provider_user_role
column.Comment: RegEx to match on the providers User level.

column.name: provider_manager_role
column.Comment: RegEx to match on the providers Manager level.

column.name: provider_admin_role
column.Comment: RegEx to match on the providers Admin level

column.name: default_role
column.Comment: must be one of: [User, Manager, Admin]

column.name: import_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a import

column.name: type
column.Comment: The type of the import (i.e. guest, user, etc.)

column.name: status
column.Comment: If the status of the import (i.e. pending, processing, failed)

column.name: start_timestamp
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp representing when the import began

column.name: end_timestamp
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp representing when the import was completed

column.name: user_id
column.Comment: The user that initiated the import

column.name: on_conflict
column.Comment: If a conflict record is found, what action should the system take

column.name: import_record_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a import record

column.name: import_id
column.Comment: The import that the import record is for

column.name: company_id
column.Comment: The company that the import record is for

column.name: status
column.Comment: If the status of the record (i.e. pending, added, failed)

column.name: reason
column.Comment: If the record wasnt added, this explains why

column.name: data
column.Comment: The data that was provided about the record

column.name: resource_id
column.Comment: The resource id tied to the record that was created by the import.

column.name: gateway_device_id
column.Comment: The gateway device to use for this number

column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: number_length

column.Comment: The regex to see if it is a valid local number

column.name: message_blueprint_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a message_blueprint

column.name: reservation_event_type_id
column.Comment: The id of the reservation event type the blueprint is attached to.

column.name: message_blueprint_template_id
column.Comment: The message_blueprint_template that was used to create the message_blueprint

column.name: company_id
column.Comment: The company the message_blueprint belongs to

column.name: name
column.Comment: The name of the message_blueprint

column.name: text
column.Comment: The content of the message_blueprint (may contain variables)

column.name: rank
column.Comment: The rank of the message_blueprint used to break a tie when multiple blueprint requirements are met (lower numbers take priority)

column.name: previous_reservation_required
column.Comment: If a previous reservation is required for this message_blueprint

column.name: previous_conversation_required
column.Comment: If a previous conversation is required for this message_blueprint

column.name: tag_group_id
column.Comment: The tag group that this message_blueprint utilizes

column.name: delay
column.Comment: The delay to use when sending out a message with this message_blueprint (stored in seconds)

column.name: category_id
column.Comment: The category to use when sending out a message with this message_blueprint

column.name: location_id
column.Comment: The location to use when sending out a message with this message_blueprint

column.name: staff_dialog_stored_message_id
column.Comment: The staff dialog to be returned with the message blueprint (stored as a stored_message).

column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.Comment: Last request made by this printer id

column.name: created
column.Comment: the timestamp representing when this action was created.

column.name: expires
column.Comment: the timestamp representing when this action will expire and become no longer actionable.

column.name: action_type
column.Comment: Keyword used for code to switch on when creating the action object when the opportunity becomes active.

column.name: label
column.Comment: Used as a header for the action to describe the purpose of this action.

column.name: message_template
column.Comment: The message content for this action describing the proposed actiono.

column.name: lifespan_seconds
column.Comment: how long in seconds the action will remain active for before expiring

column.name: event_name
column.Comment: An optional sub-type of event to further refine which event will trigger a particular pso.

column.name: event_type
column.Comment: The kind of event which will trigger a particular pso.

column.name: time_triggered
column.Comment: The timestamp representing when the event with triggered the creation of this pso occurred.

column.name: state
column.Comment: the different states a pso could be in. Determines whether the opportunity is currently active, expired, ect.

column.name: schedule_interval
column.Comment: the unit of time this schedule relates to. "days", "seconds", etc.

column.name: OFFSET
column.Comment: how many units of "schedule_interval" after triggering event until the action is eligable for action.

column.name: start_window
column.Comment: The earliest time of the day which is within the schedule window. ex "2pm"

column.name: end_window
column.Comment: The latest time of theh day which is within the schedule window. ex "6pm"

column.name: property_id
column.Comment: The primary key and the property that has a surrogate, a company_id

column.name: surrogate_property_id
column.Comment: The surrogate property to be used instead of the "property_id", a company_id

column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: created_by
column.Comment: The Kipsu user id of the user who created the record

column.Comment: The Kipsu user id of the user who updated the record

column.name: updated_at_dt
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: queue_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a queue

column.name: loc_id
column.Comment: Foreign key that links a queue to a location

column.name: active
column.Comment: Determines whether or not the queue will be available for use

column.name: type
column.Comment: Determines the type of queue, e.g. LIFO, priority queue, etc.

column.name: name
column.Comment: The name of the queue, which is displayed to users

column.name: default_unit_time
column.Comment: The default time (in seconds) to be used for estimating how long a time slot will be

column.name: initial_notification_time
column.Comment: The amount of time (in seconds) after scheduling a reservation before a notification is sent

column.name: reminder_time
column.Comment: The amount of time (in seconds) before an appointment that an appointment reminder will be sent

column.name: survey_time
column.Comment: The amount of time (in seconds) after an appointment that a follow-up survey message will be sent

column.name: queue_customer_message_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a queue_customer_message

column.name: customer_reservation_id
column.Comment: Foreign key that links a queue_customer_message to a customer_reservation

column.name: queue_message_id
column.Comment: Foreign key that links a queue_customer_message to a queue_message

column.name: msg_id
column.Comment: Foreign key that links a queue_customer_message to a message

column.name: queue_message_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a queue_message

column.Comment: Foreign key that links a queue_message to a queue

column.name: stored_id
column.Comment: Foreign key that links a queue_message to a stored_message

column.name: type
column.Comment: Indicates how the linked message is to be used with the queue, i.e. for the initial notification, for a reminder, etc.

column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a queue_reservation

column.name: queue_id
column.Comment: Foreign key that links a queue_reservation to a queue

column.name: reservation_id
column.Comment: Foreign key that links a queue_reservation to a reservation

column.name: fixed
column.Comment: Indicates whether the reservation has a fixed time in the queue or if it can be moved

column.Comment: The category of the suggested reply

column.name: context_type
column.Comment: Describes the type of message context of the original_guest_message

column.name: context_text
column.Comment: The text of the message immediately before the current incoming message

column.name: suggested_reply_group_id
column.Comment: The guest message that prompted the suggestions to be provided

column.name: suggestion_id
column.Comment: Provided if the action was taken on a specific suggestion instead of the suggestion group

column.name: procedure_name
column.Comment: The name of the stored procedure being called

column.name: tables_affected
column.Comment: A list of tables affected by the stored procedure

column.name: variables_provided
column.Comment: A list of variable names and values provided to the stored procedure

column.name: created_by
column.Comment: The mysql user calling the stored procedure

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: survey_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a administered survey

column.name: survey_blueprint_id
column.Comment: The survey_blueprint that was used to create this survey

column.name: customer_number_id
column.Comment: The customer_numbers record that the syrvey was administered to

column.name: status
column.Comment: The status of the survey (i.e. scheduled, in progress, deleted)

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: survey_blueprint_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a survey_blueprint

column.name: company_id
column.Comment: The company the survey_blueprint belongs to

column.name: name
column.Comment: The name of the survey_blueprint

column.name: type
column.Comment: The type of the survey_blueprint

column.name: active
column.Comment: If the survey blueprint is currently active and should be sent out

column.name: survey_scheduling_rule_id
column.Comment: The survey scheduling rule to be used for the blueprint

column.name: starting_survey_blueprint_message_id
column.Comment: The survey_blueprint_message_id to start the survey with

column.name: minimum_stay_length
column.Comment: The minimum number of days for this survey to be selected

column.name: maximum_stay_length
column.Comment: The maximum number of days for this survey to be selected

column.name: tag_group_id
column.Comment: The tag group that this survey blueprint utilizes

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: survey_blueprint_message_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a survey_blueprint_message

column.name: survey_blueprint_id
column.Comment: The survey_blueprint that the message belongs to

column.name: text
column.Comment: The content of the message_blueprint (may contain variables)

column.name: type
column.Comment: The type of the survey_blueprint

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: survey_message_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a survey message

column.name: survey_id
column.Comment: The survey that the message is a part of

column.name: message_id
column.Comment: The message that was sent as a part of the survey

column.name: survey_blueprint_message_id
column.Comment: The survey_blueprint_message that the message is an isntance of, if applicable

column.name: parsed_response
column.Comment: The parsed response of the survey message (i.e. a letter or numerical response)

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: survey_response_route_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a survey_response_route

column.name: survey_blueprint_message_id
column.Comment: The survey_blueprint_message that should be used if criteria is met

column.name: parent_survey_blueprint_message_id
column.Comment: The survey_blueprint_message that leads to this route being utilized

column.name: selection_criteria
column.Comment: The selection criteria for this route to be selected

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: survey_scheduling_rule_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies the survey scheduling rule

column.name: rule
column.Comment: The name of the scheduling rule

column.name: value
column.Comment: The value to be used for the scheduling rule

column.name: time_of_day
column.Comment: The time of day to send the survey.

column.name: spread
column.Comment: The number of minutes to spread a survey scheduling time across.

column.name: repeat_gap
column.Comment: The number of minutes to that must exist between instances of the survey being sent.

column.name: start_time
column.Comment: start time a survey can be scheduled after a conversation is completed

column.name: end_time
column.Comment: end time a survey can be scheduled after a conversation is completed

column.name: cancel_survey_with_active_conversation
column.Comment: At time of sending, do not send survey message is there is an active conversation

column.name: schedule_at_max_spread
column.Comment: Schedule survey sending time at max spread.

column.name: schedule_on_reservation_start_date
column.Comment: Only schedule survey on first date of reservation.

column.name: cancel_survey_if_outside_reservation_dates
column.Comment: Cancel the survey message if survey message is outside of the reservation dates

column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.Comment: This denotes where it sits in a sequence e.g. 0, 1, 2, etc. If greater than 0, previous_touchpoint_id will reference the pk of the previous touchpoint in the sequence.

column.Comment: Same as the signature field of a Kipsu User.

column.name: end_date_interval
column.Comment: A positive number represents time in hours after a date. Negative implies time in hours before a date.

column.name: notice_date_interval
column.Comment: A positive number represents time in hours after a date. Negative implies time in hours before a date.

column.name: renewal_date_interval
column.Comment: A positive number represents time in hours after a date. Negative implies time in hours before a date.

column.name: termination_date_interval
column.Comment: A positive number represents time in hours after a date. Negative implies time in hours before a date.

column.name: resident_no_response_interval
column.Comment: Represents time in hours after the event.

column.name: work_order_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a work order

column.name: company_id
column.Comment: The company that this work order is tied to

column.name: work_order_status_id
column.Comment: The current status of the work ordered

column.name: created_timestamp
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp representing when the time the work order was initially occurred

column.name: updated_timestamp
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp representing the last time the work order was updated

column.name: active
column.Comment: If the work order has not been deleted

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: work_order_issue_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a work_order/issue association

column.name: work_order_id
column.Comment: The work order that the association refers to

column.name: issue_id
column.Comment: The issue that the work order is linked to

column.name: work_order_status_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a work order status

column.name: name
column.Comment: The name attached the work order status

column.name: text
column.Comment: Multiple SMSs allowed, can have a custom message break

column.name: created_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was created

column.name: updated_at
column.Comment: The timestamp of when the record was last updated

column.name: parent
column.Comment: 0 = no parent

column.name: loc_phone_number
column.Comment: Needs to be in 15072546428 format, or can be an email

column.name: loc_active
column.Comment: If a location is no longer active, this will disable it from being viewed on the UI

column.name: gateway_device_id
column.Comment: The gateway device to use for this number

column.name: international_number_format_id
column.Comment: The id of the internationalized number format for the number

column.name: mms_enabled
column.Comment: Set to 1 if the number should be able to send mms messages, 0 if not.

column.name: reservation_id
column.Comment: The primary key that uniquely identifies a reservation

column.name: reservation_art
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp representing when the reservation begins

column.name: reservation_end
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp representing when the reservation ends

column.name: label
column.Comment: An optional name for a reservation

column.name: site
column.Comment: An optional name of the location where the reservation is, i.e. "Building A"

column.name: room_number
column.Comment: An optional field indicating the room number or specific location for the reservation

column.name: customer_Number_id
column.Comment: Optional foreign key to the associated customer_numbers record

column.name: reservation_event_timestamp
column.Comment: A Unix timestamp representing when the event occured

column.name: author
column.Comment: either phone number or userID

column.name: sender
